solution_line_template: Janet has {initial_figures} action figures and sells {sells_figures} so she has {initial_figures} - {sells_figures} = <<{initial_figures}-{sells_figures}={figures_after_selling}>>{figures_after_selling} action figures left.
She then buys {buys_figures} more so she now has {figures_after_selling} + {buys_figures} = <<{figures_after_selling}+{buys_figures}={figures_after_buying}>>{figures_after_buying} action figures.
Her brother gives her his collection which is {brother_multiplier} * {figures_after_buying} = <<{brother_multiplier}*{figures_after_buying}={brother_collection}>>{brother_collection} action figures.
Now in total, she has {figures_after_buying} + {brother_collection} = <<{figures_after_buying}+{brother_collection}={total_figures}>>{total_figures} action figures.
